Slide text:
LECTURE 5: 
Budgeting and variance analysis 
Sustainable Management Accounting
1

Slide text:
At the end of this part, you should be able to:

Explain the functions, process, and product of budgeting;

Explain criticisms against budgets;

Explain the improvements, complements, and alternatives 
suggested to overcome these criticisms;

Explain the purposes and principles of variance analysis;

Compute and report variances;

Interpret variances.
Learning objectives
2

Slide text:
What is a budget?
3
A budget is 
a detailed document which
translates a plan of action 
into financial terms 
over a limited time horizon. 
It specifies short-term financial objectives and the amount of resources
needed to achieve these objectives. 
It can be broken down into shorter periods, typically quarters and months.

Slide text:
What are the steps of budgeting?
5Strategic PlanningOperational BudgetingFinancial BudgetingCapital BudgetingSales BudgetProduction BudgetProcurement BudgetAdministrative BudgetPro-forma financial statementsCash Budget

Slide text:
What are the criticisms against budgeting?
6
They are costly to implement and subject to rapid obsolescence;
They create organizational inertia and cause missed business 
opportunities;
They foster dysfunctional behaviors among managers.

Slide text:
What has been done against these criticisms?
7
Improve the way people build and use budgets:
Participative budgeting;
Continuous budgeting; and
Zero-Based Budgeting
Add systems complementing budgeting:
The Balanced Scorecard (BSC);
Benchmarking and Relative Performance Evaluation (RPE).
Overcome budgeting: Beyond Budgeting

Slide text:
What is variance analysis and what is it good for?
55
Variance analysis involves systematically comparing actual with 
planned results for a given period. 
It relies on the systematic assessment of the impact on Operating 
Income of differences between actual and budgeted performances.
Variance analysis serves the following purposes:
Directing attention;
Organizational learning; and
Performance evaluation and reward.

Slide text:
Computing variances (selection!)
57
static budget variance:
= (Qa × UCMa - FCa) - (Qb × UCMb - FCb)
volume variance:
= (Qa - Qb) × UCMb
flexible budget variance:
= Qa × (UCMa - UCMb) - (FCa - FCb)
Q = Volume, UCM = unit contribution margin, FC = Fixed costs, a = actual, b = budget

Slide text:
Computing variances (selection!)
58
selling price variance:
= Qa × (Pa - Pb)
material usage variance:
= Qa × (MUa - MUb) × MPb
material price variance:
= Qa × MUa × (MPa - MPb)
Q = Volume, MC = unit material costs, MU = material usage per 
unit, MP = material price per unit, a = actual, b = budget
selling price variance:
= Qa × (Pa - Pb)
labor usage variance:
= Qa × (LUa - LUb) × LPb
labor price variance:
= Qa × LUa × (LPa - LPb)
Q = Volume, LC = labour cost per unit, LU = Labour usage (time) 
per unit, LP = labour price per unit, a = actual, b = budget
